channel.title: Delta vs. PI vs. Shard vs. Hyperion vs. Azure vs. Runesource vs. Others
channel.description: Which do you think is the best? My vote is for Delta.

item.title: Delta vs. PI vs. Shard vs. Hyperion vs. Azure vs. Runesource vs. Others
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:42, topic:440164”][quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=542845.msg3980167#msg3980167 date=1335140871]

Apollo is a failed project. I like RuneSource but Blake cut corners in multiple places. Hyperion is overrated. PI has tons of content, tons of tutorials, I’d give my vote to PI just for that.

why is apollo a failed project? It’s just more difficult to use and anti-noobed :L but it comes out as the most stable base out
Pi is overused, over and over again giving the community a bad name with poor results, but
content wise, you are right, give it to PI. More easily organized.
Hyperion, can have some content, but is arranged more difficult, but there was a good result of it , PJA, more known for its stability but later got knocked of stage: runesource and Apollo
runesource, has content and is stable
i remember battlescape was pretty good once as well.
[/quote]

Apollo is a developers nightmare. It failed to serve it’s purpose as providing multiple revision capability and lacked in many core features. The abstraction is terrible, overused, and the learning curve is too steep for any average joe. Not to mention that it is extensible in Ruby through plugins that no one would want to learn how to use. This has been proven. The release is rarely used as compared to Hyperion and Runesource.[/quote]
ye cause server dev thread shows all the projects that people are working on (sarcasm kinda)

Read full topic
item.source: Delta vs. PI vs. Shard vs. Hyperion vs. Azure vs. Runesource vs. Others

item.title: Delta vs. PI vs. Shard vs. Hyperion vs. Azure vs. Runesource vs. Others
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:39, topic:440164”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=542845.msg3980164#msg3980164 date=1335140244]
Apollo is a failed project. I like RuneSource but Blake cut corners in multiple places. Hyperion is overrated. PI has tons of content, tons of tutorials, I’d give my vote to PI just for that.
[/quote]
why is apollo a failed project? It’s just more difficult to use and anti-noobed :L but it comes out as the most stable base out
Pi is overused, over and over again giving the community a bad name with poor results, but
content wise, you are right, give it to PI. More easily organized.
Hyperion, can have some content, but is arranged more difficult, but there was a good result of it , PJA, more known for its stability but later got knocked of stage: runesource and Apollo
runesource, has content and is stable
i remember battlescape was pretty good once as well.[/quote]

Apollo is a developers nightmare. It failed to serve it’s purpose as providing multiple revision capability and lacked in many core features. The abstraction is terrible, overused, and the learning curve is too steep for any average joe. Not to mention that it is extensible in Ruby through plugins that no one would want to learn how to use. This has been proven. The release is rarely used as compared to Hyperion and Runesource.

Read full topic
